intro: Tephrosia florida var. gracillima, commonly known as the Florida tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. It produces clusters of small, showy white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
